Under Article 53 of the Protocol “*it is prohibited: to commit any acts of hostility directed against the historic monuments, works of art or places of worship which constitute the cultural or spiritual heritage of peoples”.*  Given the huge number of russian genocidal attacks on Ukrainian culture, we can only list few example here.


## UNESCO cultural heritage

On July 23, 2023, Russia launched 19 missiles at the southern city of Odesa. The attack damaged 29 objects of the cultural heritage of national and local significance, particularly those located within the UNESCO-protected historical center of Odesa. Due to the enemy attack, the buildings of the 19th and 20th centuries were damaged Russian shelling severely damaged the UNESCO-protected Transfiguration Cathedral, one of the biggest and oldest in Odesa. [^warcrimes-culture-3]
